results.title: Nowhere in Africa = Nirgendwo in Afrika
results.creator_credit: Caroline Link, Peter Herrmann, MC One Productions, Bavaria Film and Constantin Film
results.brief_description: As the title suggests, a Jewish family migrate from WWII Germany to Kenya in Africa and find themselves displaced persons and “Nowhere in Africa”. The father Walter, previously a lawyer in Germany, goes on ahead to establish himself and then sends for his socialite wife Jettel and young daughter Regina to come as soon as possible. Struggling with temporary internment by the British and being sacked as farm manager, the family are soon re-established on a new farm and try to cope with being land mangers. The family are bound together, and to the place they now live, through their African cook, Owuor (Sidede Onyulo), who has a special bond with Regina. Letters from home confirm their worst fears as the family members they left behind are sent to live in ghettos and to ‘work camps’. After the war, the family, now established in Africa, struggle with the idea of returning to Germany. A heartfelt and personal family drama located in an imposing landscape and set to a moving musical score. Nominated for an Academy Award in 2002 for Best Foreign Language Film and winner of five German Film Awards. Based on an autobiographical novel by Stefanie Sweig. Cast includes: Juliane Kohler, Merab Ninidze, Matthias Habich, Lea Kurka, Karoline Eckertz.

results.title: Red Beard = Akahige
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The last collaboration between actor Toshiro Mifune and Kurosawa, is a moral tale about a young and arrogant medical graduate - charged by his modern training and ambition - who is devastated to be assigned to an impoverished local clinic. The young doctor’s mentor, Red Beard, aims to show the young gun that there is more to life than prestige and power and more to healing than medicine. Set in 1820, this is a poignant and compassionate work; a humanistic narrative that follows the character’s arc from supercilious to empathetic whilst presenting a myriad of stories about the villagers and their struggles.

results.title: Strange planet
results.creator_credit: Emma-Kate Croghan, Anastasia Sideris, Stavros Kazantzidis, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Emma-Kate Croghan made a great splash with her debut feature “Love and other catastrophes”; this, her follow-up work, was less successful, being a somewhat formulaic tale about love and destiny. The narrative centres around three friends, Alice, Judy and Sally, who are adrift in their late 20s, looking for love, career prospects and direction in life. Unbeknownst to them, three eligible men are also on similar paths, dealing with a variety of catastrophes and missteps. Will these six find love, career fulfilment and buffering from the trials and tribulations of life? Probably. Cast includes: Claudia Karvan, Naomi Watts, Alice Garner, Tom Long, Felix Williamson and Hugo Weaving.

results.title: Power and terror: Noam Chomsky in our times
results.brief_description: A series of lectures by eminent American expert on foreign policy, Noam Chomsky, are centred around the issues of September 11 - the United States’ response to the disaster, as well as the Government’s participation in terrorism. Chomsky displays his signature articulation and intelligence in these illuminating pieces, providing a complex picture of world politics. He deftly places the terrorist attacks in the context of American foreign intervention throughout the decades: for example in Vietnam, Central America and the Middle East. In stark and uncompromising terms Chomsky presents his views that challenge widely held perceptions about America’s motivations, in a refreshingly composed and astute way. Some lectures include question and answer forums with the audience.

results.title: The Party's over = The Last party 2000
results.creator_credit: Donovan, Rebecca Chaiklin, Stanley F Buchthal, Palisades Pictures, Dakota Group and Camoflauge
results.brief_description: Philip Seymour Hoffman hosts an exploration of the state of politics in the United States, leading up to the 2000 election. Hoffman collects a variety of perspectives by attending a Farm Aid concert, various rallies, political conventions, a primary school, a NRA gun show, a Christian coalition, and prison towns. By interviewing the young and old, the famous and the obscure, the filmmakers strive to present a multifarious picture of America. Whilst the results are not polished, the work does capture the scandals of the election, including the faulty ballot cards, re-counts and the decision of the Supreme Court to appoint Bush. Interviews include Willie Nelson, Susan Sarandon, Noam Chomsky, and Michael Moore.

results.title: The Corporation
results.creator_credit: Jennifer Abbott, Mark Achbar, Bart Simpson and Big Picture Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Entertaining, illuminating and exhaustively researched Canadian documentary about the rise in power and stature of corporations, and the impact felt throughout the world. Many topics are examined over the course of this work including exploitation of developing countries, company fraud, environmental impact of business on the natural world, business ethics, corporate espionage, media power, censorship, globalisation, marketing manipulation, privatisation and protests. Featuring a wide array of interviews, witty graphics and a soothing voice-over, the filmmakers succeed in making the complexities of the issues at play here understood whilst enrapturing the audience. Winner of the Best Documentary World Cinema Audience Award at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival. Interviewees include: Naomi Klein, Michael Moore and Noam Chomsky.

results.title: Springtime in a small town = Xiao cheng zhi chun
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang, Ting Yatming, Li Xiaowan, Bill Kong, China Film Group Corporation and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Finely crafted romantic drama about a young married woman who dutifully cares for her sickly husband, but whose feelings for a former beau reawakens her desire. Set amid the post-WW2 ruins of a small town, this film exquisitely portrays Yuwens longing, which contrasts with her efficient but cold care of her ailing and ill-tempered husband. Director Tian Zhuangzuang (The Blue kite), part of the fifth generation of Chinese filmmakers observes his protagonists through doorways and windows, providing an apt metaphor for their inability to connect. A film that allows the tension to build in a languid but effective manner, as the three angst ridden players make their choices. Cast includes Hu Jingfan, Wu Jun, Xin Baiqing, Ye Xiaokeng and Lu Sisi.

results.title: Amandla! A revolution in four-part harmony
results.creator_credit: Lee Hirsch, Sherry Simpson, Desiree Markgraaf, South African Broadcasting Corporation, Kwela Productions, Ford Foundation, Cinemax Reel Life and Bomb
results.brief_description: Celebratory, but also poignant, documentary about the history of South African apartheid, as seen through the eyes of numerous black South African musicians and artists. Interviews are interwoven with footage from the 1940s and beyond — footage that portrays the awful discrimination and brutality of apartheid. Activists used music to express their rage and frustration at the ruling government, often incurring the wrath of the oppressive regime with their protest songs. The dissenters used these songs to mobilise the masses while venting their sorrow at the injustices being suffered. These artists argue convincingly that the songs were integral to the struggle, providing an inestimable tole in the victory over apartheid. Performers and interviewees include: Thandi Modise, Vusi Mahlasela, Sibongile Khumalo, Duma KaNdlovu, Sibusiso Nxumalo, Lindiwe Zulu, Miriam Makeba, Abdullah Ibrahim, Sifiso Ntuli, Dolly Rathebe, and Hugh Masekela.

results.title: Playtime [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Rene Silvera and Specta Films
results.brief_description: The third of Tati’s films to feature the gangling form of Monsieur Hulot, “Playtime” is a surreal, comic vision of mankind’s battle against the overwhelming depersonalisation of modern city life. Filmed upon one of the most ambitious and imaginative sets ever to grace the screen, Tati’s cinematic magnum opus took three years and a reported one million pounds to shoot. The result is a startling triumph acclaimed by the international media as Tati’s finest work. Also available on VHS [302002].

results.title: Mr. Hulot's holiday = M. Hulot's holiday [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain, Discana and Cady
results.brief_description: In the pipe-smoking daydreamer Mr. Hulot, Jaques Tati created one of the most adored and one of the funniest of screen clowns. In a sleepy seaside resort town, Hulot is the centre of increasing chaos: deckchairs behave anarchically, a summer Ball turns into a disaster. Amidst it all Mr. Hulot wanders around oblivious to the madness. “Mr. Hulot’s Holiday” is a beautifully orchestrated piece of comic cinema and widely considered Tati’s funniest film. Also available on VHS [303607].
